headline: HP appoints Bruce Broussard as interim CEO
summary: HP Inc ​on Tuesday ‌named Bruce Broussard ‌as the company's interim chief ⁠executive ‌officer effective immediately. He succeeds ‍Enrique Lores, who has stepped ​down as ‌President and CEO and as a member of the ⁠board ​to pursue ​another professional opportunity, the ‍company ⁠said.

headline: HP Inc. to Announce First Quarter Fiscal 2026 Earnings on Feb 24, 2026
summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., Feb. 03, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- HP Inc. (NYSE: HPQ) will present a live audio webcast of a conference call to review financial results for the first fiscal quarter ended January 31, 2026 on Tuesday, Feb 24, 2026 at 5:00 p.m. ET / 2:00 p.m. PT. The webcast will be available at www.hp.com/investor/2026Q1Webcast. A replay of the audio webcast will be available at the same website shortly after the call and will remain available for approximately one year. About HP Inc. HP Inc.

headline: PayPal Appoints Enrique Lores as Chief Executive Officer and David W. Dorman as Independent Board Chair
summary: PayPal Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: PYPL) today announced that its Board of Directors has appointed Enrique Lores as President and CEO, effective March 1, 2026. Lores, who has served on the PayPal Board for nearly five years and as Board Chair since July 2024, succeeds Alex Chriss. To ensure a seamless transition, Jamie Miller, Chief Financial and Operating Officer, will serve as Interim CEO until Lores assumes the role. David W. Dorman has been appointed as Independent Board Chair, effective immediat

headline: Disney, PayPal name new CEOs: Why this matters
summary: HP Inc. (HPQ) CEO Enrique Lores announced that he will be leaving the company to be the chief executive at PayPal (PYPL), while Disney (DIS) has officially named its parks division chairman Josh D'Amaro to be its next CEO after Bob Iger. Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi reports on these latest C-suite shakeups. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out Yahoo Finance.

content.description:
HP Inc. (HPQ) CEO Enrique Lores announced that he will be leaving the company to be the chief executive at PayPal (PYPL), while Disney (DIS) has officially named its parks division chairman Josh D'Amaro to be its next CEO after Bob Iger.

Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi reports on these latest C-suite shakeups.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out Yahoo Finance.

headline: PayPal Poaches HP’s CEO in Rare Tech Leadership Raid – What HP Knows That We Don’t
summary: PayPal Holdings (NASDAQ:PYPL) just did something nearly unheard of in Silicon Valley: it poached a sitting CEO from another public company. Enrique Lores, who led HP Inc (NYSE:HPQ) through six consecutive quarters of revenue growth, is now PayPal’s new chief executive as of February 3, 2026. This wasn’t a quiet retirement transition or a graceful ... PayPal Poaches HP’s CEO in Rare Tech Leadership Raid – What HP Knows That We Don’t

headline: PayPal replaces CEO Chriss with HP's Lores
summary: PayPal is replacing CEO Alex Chriss with Enrique Lores, saying that the pace of change and execution at the company has not met board expectations over the past two years.  Lores has served as a PayPal board member for almost five years and has been board Chair since July 2024.  “The payments industry is changing faster than ever, driven by new technologies, evolving regulations, an increasingly competitive landscape, and the rapid acceleration of AI that is reshaping commerce daily,” Lores said in a statement on Tuesday.

content.title: PayPal replaces CEO Chriss with HP's Lores
content.summary: PayPal is replacing CEO Alex Chriss with Enrique Lores, saying that the pace of change and execution at the company has not met board expectations over the past two years.  Lores has served as a PayPal board member for almost five years and has been board Chair since July 2024.  “The payments industry is changing faster than ever, driven by new technologies, evolving regulations, an increasingly competitive landscape, and the rapid acceleration of AI that is reshaping commerce daily,” Lores said in a statement on Tuesday.

headline: PayPal Names HP Inc.’s Lores as CEO and Misses Earnings Estimates. Stock Drops 17%.
summary: PayPal Holdings  made a splash Tuesday as it attempts to engineer a turnaround, replacing CEO Alex Chriss with current  HP Inc.  Chief Executive Enrique Lores.  Lores, who has served as HP’s CEO since 2019, will take the helm on March 1.  Jamie Miller, PayPal’s chief financial and operating officer, will serve as interim CEO for the rest of the month.

headline: HP stock drops 6% as CEO Enrique Lores exits for PayPal
summary: Investing.com -- HP Inc. (NYSE:HPQ) stock fell 6% Tuesday after the company announced that CEO Enrique Lores has stepped down to pursue another opportunity, with PayPal Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) simultaneously revealing his appointment as their next President and CEO.

content.title: HP stock drops 6% as CEO Enrique Lores exits for PayPal

headline: Why HP (HPQ) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of personal computing and printing company HP (NYSE:HPQ) fell 5.5% in the morning session after the company announced the immediate resignation of its CEO, Enrique Lores, which was followed by downgrades from several investment banks. Lores stepped down from his role as President, CEO, and board member to become the new chief executive at PayPal. In response to the leadership change, both Barclays and Goldman Sachs downgraded HP's stock. Barclays lowered its rating to "Underweight," while

headline: PayPal's growing competition is a 'pressure point': Analyst
summary: PayPal's stock is sinking on Tuesday after reporting fourth quarter earnings results alongside a weak 2026 outlook. This news coincides with the payment platform picking HP Inc. (HPQ) CEO Enrique Lores to be its next chief executive, effective March 1. Enrique will be leaving his position at HP, which he's held since 2019. Macquarie Capital senior equity research analyst Paul Golding — who has an Outperform rating on the stock — reacts to PayPal's earnings release and guidance figures. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.description:

(HPQ) CEO Enrique Lores to be its next chief executive, effective March 1. Enrique will be leaving his position at HP, which he's held since 2019.

Macquarie Capital senior equity research analyst Paul Golding — who has an Outperform rating on the stock — reacts to PayPal's earnings release and guidance figures.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: HP Leadership Shakeup Puts Focus On Valuation And Future Direction
summary: HP (NYSE:HPQ) announced the resignation of CEO Enrique Lores, effective immediately. Bruce Broussard has been appointed Interim CEO while the board begins a formal search for a permanent successor. Lores is set to take a chief executive role at another high profile corporation, raising fresh questions about HP's leadership path. For investors watching NYSE:HPQ, this leadership change comes at a time when the stock has faced pressure, with the share price at $19.81 and a 1 year return of a...
